gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਬਿਸਨ ਸੀਸ ਨਿਵਾੲਿ ॥ ਕਰਿ ਜੋਰਿ ਕਹੀ ਬਨਾੲਿ ॥
transliteration: Tab Bisan Sees Nivaae|| Kar(i) Jor(i) Kahibanaae||
translation: Then Vishnu bowing his head said with folded hands,

gurmukhi: ਧਰਿਹੋਂ ਦਿਨਾਂਤ ਵਤਾਰ ॥ ਜਿਤ ਹੋੲਿ ਜਗਤ ਕੁਮਾਰ ॥੮॥
transliteration: Dharihon Dinaant Vataar|| Jit Hoe Jagad Koumaar||8||
translation: “I shall assume the form of Chandra incarnation, so that the beauty may prosper in the world.8.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਮਹਾਂ ਤੇਜ ਮੁਰਾਰ ॥ ਧਰਿਯੋ ਸੁ ਚੰਦ੍ਰ ਅਵਤਾਰ ॥
transliteration: Tah Mahaan Tej Muraar|| Dhariyo Su Channdra Avtaar||
translation: Then the extremely glorious Vishnu manifested himself as Chandra (incarnation),

gurmukhi: ਤਨ ਕੈ ਮਦਨ ਕੋ ਬਾਨ ॥ ਮਾਰਿਯੋ ਤ੍ਰੀਯਨ ਕਹ ਤਾਨ ॥੯॥
transliteration: Tan Kai Madan Ko Baan|| Maariyo Treeyan Kah Taan||9||
translation: And he shot continuously the arrows of the god of love towards women.9.

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਤੇ ਭੲੀ ਤ੍ਰੀਯ ਦੀਨ ॥ ਸਭ ਗਰਬ ਹੁਅੈ ਗਯੋ ਛੀਨ ॥
transliteration: Taa Te Bhaitreeya Deen|| Sabh Gadab Huai Gado Chheen||
translation: Because of this the women became modest and all their pride was shattered.

gurmukhi: ਲਾਗੀ ਕਰਨ ਪਤਿ ਸੇਵ ॥ ਯਾਤੇ ਪ੍ਰਸੰਨਿ ਭੲੇ ਦੇਵ ॥੧੦॥
transliteration: Laagikaran Pat(i) Sev|| Yaate Prasann(i) Bhae Dev||10||
translation: They again began to perform service to their husbands and by this all the gods were pleased.10.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁ ਕ੍ਰਿਸਾ ਲਾਗੀ ਹੋਨ ॥ ਲਖ ਚੰਦ੍ਰਮਾ ਕੀ ਜੌਨ ॥
transliteration: Bahu Kridaa Laagihon|| Lakh Channdramaa Kijaoun||
translation: Seeing Chandra, people began to do farming to a large extent.

gurmukhi: ਸਭ ਭੲੇ ਸਿਧ ਬਿਚਾਰ ॥ ੲਿਮ ਭਯੋ ਚੰਦ੍ਰ ਅਵਤਾਰ ॥੧੧॥
transliteration: Sabh Bhae Sidh Bichaar|| Im Bhayo Channdra Avtaar||11||
translation: All the thoughts-out works were accomplished, in this manner, Chandra incarnation came into being.11.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਮ ਹਰਿ ਧਰਾ ਚੰਦ੍ਰ ਅਵਤਾਰਾ ॥ ਬਢਿਯੋ ਗਰਬ ਲਹਿ ਰੂਪ ਅਪਾਰਾ ॥
transliteration: Im Har(i) Dharaa Channdra Avtaaraa|| Badhiyo Gadab Lah(i) Roop Apaaraa||
translation: In this way Vishnu manifested himself as Chandra incarnation, but Chandra also became egoistic about his own beauty;

gurmukhi: ਅਾਨ ਕਿਸੂ ਕਹੁ ਚਿਤ ਨ ਲਿਅਾਯੋ ॥ ਤਾਤੇ ਤਾਹਿ ਕਲੰਕ ਲਗਾਯੋ ॥੧੨॥
transliteration: Aan Kisoo Kauh Chit Na Liaayo|| Taate Taah(i) Kalank Lagadyo||12||
translation: He also abandoned the meditation of any other, therefore he was also blemished.12.

gurmukhi: ਭਜਤ ਭਯੋ ਅੰਬਰ ਕੀ ਦਾਰਾ ॥ ਤਾ ਤੇ ਕੀਯ ਮੁਨ ਰੋਸ ਅਪਾਰਾ ॥
transliteration: Bhajat Bhayo Anbar Kidaaraa|| Taa Te Keeya Mounndros Apaaraa||
translation: He was engrossed with the wife of the sage (Gautam), which made th sage highly infuriated in his mind;

gurmukhi: ਕਿਸਨਾਰਜੁਨ ਮ੍ਰਿਗ ਚਰਮ ਚਲਾਯੋ ॥ ਤਿਹ ਕਰਿ ਤਾਹਿ ਕਲੰਕ ਲਗਾਯੋ ॥੧੩॥
transliteration: Kisnaarjoun Mrig Charam Chalaayo|| Tih Kar(i) Taah(i) Kalank Lagadyo||13||
translation: The sage struck him with his deer-skin, which created a mark on his body and he was thus blemished.13.

gurmukhi: ਸ੍ਰਾਪ ਲਗਯੋ ਤਾਂ ਕੋ ਮੁਨ ਸੰਦਾ ॥ ਘਟਤ ਬਢਤ ਤਾ ਦਿਨ ਤੇ ਚੰਦਾ ॥
transliteration: Sraap Lagyo Taan Ko Mounndsandaa|| Ghatat Taa Din Te Channdaa||
translation: With the curse of the sage he keeps on decreasing and increasing;
